questions.text: A researcher is studying the structure and function of the diaphragm. The researcher notices that different structures perforate the diaphragm at different vertebral levels. Which of the following pairs of structures perforate the diaphragm at T10 level?
questions.solution:
Structures that perforate the diaphragm include:
  • At T8: inferior vena cava (IVC), right phrenic nerve
  • At T10: esophagus, vagus nerve (CN X)
  • At T12: aorta, thoracic duct and azygous vein



Option Analysis

❌ Inferior vena cava and esophagus:
Incorrect: The inferior vena cava perforates the diaphragm at the T8 vertebral level.
❌ Right phrenic nerve and esophagus:
Incorrect: The right phrenic nerve perforates the diaphragm at the T8 vertebral level.
❌ Thoracic duct and azygous vein:
Incorrect: The thoracic duct and azygous vein perforate the diaphragm at the T12 vertebral level. 
❌ Aorta and azygous vein:
Incorrect: The aorta and azygous vein perforate the diaphragm at the T12 vertebral level.
✅ Esophagus and vagus nerve:
Correct: See Main Explanation
